result.execSummary:
The defendant Kathleen D Sabor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$10,000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Imposed and Stayed. Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 6 years bifurcated sentence.
Imposed and Stayed.  Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.
**CORRECTED 10-17-2016 to reflect that the term of probation is 5 years.**

miscConds.notes: Defendant is ordered to pay restitution during the pendancy of probation.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment. Restitution Joint and Several

Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

timeConds.notes: 3 months to be served, balance stayed. Huber for employment.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with victim store, Ardagh Glass Inc.,  except for restitution purposes. No contact w/any of the companies employees.   You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 4:00 p.m. Defendant has until Dec. 30, 2015 to have this done.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
